scenario:
Investors scored big wins last year as the S&P 500, Nasdaq, and Dow Jones Industrial Average all climbed by double digits. The artificial intelligence (AI) growth story is in its early days, and the Federal Reserve has launched interest rate cuts, which could support stock performance in the year ahead. 

Some stocks could stand out in 2025 and over the long term, offering a combination of growth and security. Here are the top 10 buys:

1. Eli Lilly (LLY) - maker of weight loss drugs tirzepatide and Mounjaro, which have become blockbusters, bringing in billions of dollars in revenue. The obesity drug market may reach $130 billion by 2030, and Lilly is well positioned to benefit from this growth.

2. Meta Platforms (META) - a leader in social media, generating billions of dollars in advertising revenue. The company is investing heavily in AI, which could generate other compelling products and services over time.

3. Salesforce (CRM) - a leader in customer relationship management software, with a new growth opportunity in agentic AI. The company has already signed 200 deals, and the pipeline for future deals looks strong.

4. Chewy (CHWY) - an e-commerce platform for pet owners, with a strong financial health, being debt-free and having a liquidity position of about $1.3 billion. The company has recently launched veterinary clinics to expand its business opportunity.

5. CRISPR Therapeutics (CRSP) - a gene-editing technology company that has won its first regulatory approval for a product based on its technology. The company is working on several other candidates, which could be just the beginning of its growth story.

6. Intuitive Surgical (ISRG) - the global leader in robotic surgery, with a solid moat and a competitive advantage. The company generates more quarterly revenue from the sales of instruments and accessories than from sales of the robots themselves.

7. CrowdStrike (CRWD) - a leader in cybersecurity, with a strong pipeline of deals and a loyal customer base. The company has recently experienced a major outage, but has quickly tackled the problem and offered compensation packages to customers.

8. Amazon (AMZN) - a leader in e-commerce and cloud computing, with a strong cost structure and a focus on AI. The company may become one of the biggest winners of the AI boom.

9. Nvidia (NVDA) - a chip designer and a leader in AI, with a wide range of related products and services. The company has generated double- and triple-digit revenue quarter after quarter, and has a gross margin of more than 70%.

10. SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) - an exchange-traded fund that tracks the S&P 500, offering exposure to the top players driving the day's economy. The ETF has an expense ratio of 0.09%, making it inexpensive and well worth the investment.
